reading_passages.title: About Southeast Asia
reading_passages.text: Lesson 1 Big Idea Southeast Asia is a tropical region of peninsulas, islands, and waterways with diverse plants, animals, and resources. Main Ideas •Southeast Asia’s physical features include peninsulas, islands, rivers, and many seas, straits, and gulfs.
reading_passages.main_idea: Lesson 1 Big Idea Southeast Asia is a tropical region of peninsulas, islands, and waterways with diverse plants, animals, and resources.
supporting_details: Main Ideas •Southeast Asia’s physical features include peninsulas, islands, rivers, and many seas, straits, and gulfs.

reading_passages.title: About Southeast Asia
reading_passages.text: The tropical climate of Southeast Asia supports a wide range of plants and animals.
reading_passages.main_idea: The tropical climate of Southeast Asia supports a wide range of plants and animals.

reading_passages.title: About Southeast Asia
reading_passages.text: Southeast Asia is rich in natural resources such as wood, rubber, and fossil fuels. Lesson 2 Big Idea People, ideas, and traditions from China, India, Europe, and elsewhere have shaped Southeast Asia’s history and culture. Today, many farming areas of Mainland Southeast Asia are poor but working to improve their economies.
reading_passages.main_idea: Southeast Asia is rich in natural resources such as wood, rubber, and fossil fuels.
supporting_details: Lesson 2 Big Idea People, ideas, and traditions from China, India, Europe, and elsewhere have shaped Southeast Asia’s history and culture.
Today, many farming areas of Mainland Southeast Asia are poor but working to improve their economies.

scientific_phenomena.title: Southeast Asia Ecosystem
scientific_phenomena.description: Students’ essays should •present an analysis of the topic that is detailed and relevant •develop the analysis logically, clearly, and accurately •cite at least three sources of relevant text evidence from Part 1 in support of their analysis •be organized into a distinct introduction, a main body consisting of several paragraphs, and a conclusion that sums up the main pointsWrite an Analytical Essay Using the exhibits in Part 1 and your knowledge of the economic and environmental challenges of Southeast Asia, write an analytical essay that answers the following question: Why is it hard for the people of Southeast Asia to maintain healthy economies and healthy ecosystems at the same time? Be sure to discuss various geographic, environmental, and economic factors that play a role in this challenge. Be sure to cite specific evidence from at least three sources in your response.
observation_prompts: What features of ecosystem can you identify in Southeast Asia?
How might ecosystem affect people living in Southeast Asia?
What patterns do you notice about ecosystem in Southeast Asia?

scientific_phenomena.title: Southeast Asia Mountain
scientific_phenomena.description: Between these mountains are low plateaus and river floodplains. Island Southeast Asia consists of more than 20,000 islands, some of them among the world’s largest. New Guinea is Earth’s second-largest island, and Borneo its third largest.

scientific_phenomena.title: Southeast Asia Weather
scientific_phenomena.description: Seasonal mon- soon winds from the oceans bring heavy rain in summer and drier weather in winter. Severe flooding is common during wet seasons. This climate supports savannas—areas of tall grasses and scattered trees and shrubs.

What patterns do you notice about weather in Southeast Asia?

scientific_phenomena.title: Southeast Asia Environment
scientific_phenomena.description: Students can review their graphic organizer notes at the end of the lesson to answer the following question: Predict How would the region’s environment and economy be different without monsoons? Without monsoons, rain forests might not grow, so plant and animal life might not be as diverse. Farming might not be as productive because the soil might not be as rich nor grow plants as well without the regular wet and dry seasons.

writing_prompts: Using information from the passage and your own knowledge, write an informative paragraph about Southeast Asia. Include at least three vocabulary terms from Part 1.
Describe an important geographic feature of Southeast Asia and explain its significance to the region.
Compare and contrast two aspects of Southeast Asia discussed in the reading passage.
reflection_questions: What new information did you learn about Southeast Asia?
What questions do you still have about Southeast Asia?
How does learning about Southeast Asia help you understand our world better?
How might life in Southeast Asia be similar to or different from your own?

system_identification.title: HUMAN GEOGRAPHY SYSTEMS
system_identification.instructions: Label each description with the correct human geography system: Urban, Cultural, Economic, Political, or Infrastructure.
